description: In 2015, the Los Angeles City Attorney's Office started targeting  marijuana dispensaries. This is the former location of Wilmington Buds on Avalon Boulevard in Los Angeles. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)
On the next block up from Avalon Boulevard, the dispensary LA Collective continues to operate. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)
Closed signs hang in the windows of some of the locations that were targeted by the City Attorney's Office. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)
Avalon Medical Center on Avalon Boulevard in Wilmington, shown here, was one of the locations targeted by the City Attorney's Office. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)
Avalon Center Dispensary, commonly known as Smoke Shop Avalon, also was closed. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)
Weedland, just down the block from Avalon Center Dispensary, was one of the locations served with a civil complaint, but it did not close. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)
The former location of 420 Collective, shown here, was the first dispensary in the area to be closed by the city in February 2015. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)

The new location of 420 Collective is just up Avalon Boulevard from its previous location, according to Weedmaps.com and an interview with the dispensary's security guard. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)
Shown here is the former location of Wilmington Organic Wellness, another targeted location in the Wilmington neighborhood of Los Angeles. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News21)
